column2: We are currently seeking a Network Operations Manager for our Network Infrastructure team. As our Network Operations Manager you will be responsible for managing and maintaining the organization's network infrastructure. This includes implementing and maintaining network systems, managing network security, and ensuring network availability. The IT Network Operations Manager will also manage a global team of skilled network administrators and network engineers.? Responsibilities:? Manage the day-to-day handling of incidents and service requests for the Global Network Operations team.? Oversee the operation of network systems from the edge to cloud to ensure the high performance and availability of network infrastructure.? Interface with users and other IT teams in problem resolution.? Implement and manage network security policies and procedures to protect the organization's data and systems.? Manage network capacity and performance, and plan and implement upgrades as necessary.? Manage a team of IT professionals responsible for network infrastructure support, including hiring, training, and performance management.? Provide regular reports to upper management on the status of network operations and service level.?? Ensure service level agreements (SLAs) are met and continuously improved.? Develop and implement IT service management processes and procedures for the network operation team.? Develop and maintain network documentation, including network diagrams, policies, and procedures.? Collaborate with other IT teams, including business and help desk, to ensure smooth operation of the network and application systems.? Stay updated with advancements in IT infrastructure technologies and applications.? Develop and manage budget related to network operations, forecasting and tracking IT expenses to ensure cost-effective utilization of financial resources.? Qualifications:? Bachelor's degree in a technical field or equivalent work experience.? 5+ years of experience in large scale network infrastructure management and administration.? 5+ years of people management experience, including multiple teams and remote workers.?? Security focus with the knowledge of zero-trust security framework principles.? Knowledge of best practices around management, control, and monitoring of network infrastructure.? Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.? Strong problem solving, project management and leadership abilities.? Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.? Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities.? Certifications such as CCNA, CCNP, ITILv4 or CISSP are a plus.? We   are   an   equal   opportunity   employer.   NOV is committed to building a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.? We offer a comprehensive employee benefit package including health, life, and disability insurance; a retirement plan; and paid time off. Our company is committed to crafting a lasting impact for ourselves, our customers, and the communities where we live and work.?

column1: Immediate Opening Senior Manager- IT (System Admin) - @  Chennai !!
column2: Dear Job Aspirants, Greetings from  Global Healthcare Billing Partners Pvt Ltd !!   Opening for Senior Manager - IT (System Administration).   Job Summary : The Senior Manager of network Support is responsible for leading and managing the network support team to ensure the availability, reliability, and performance of the organization's network infrastructure. This role involves strategic planning, network design, implementation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and team management. The Senior Manager will work closely with other IT teams and departments to align network initiatives with the company's overall business objectives.  Responsibilities:   Network Infrastructure Management : Design, implement, and maintain the organization's network infrastructure to meet performance, scalability, and security requirements. Ensure network availability and reliability through proactive monitoring and regular maintenance. Plan and execute network upgrades and expansion projects as needed. 2.  Team Leadership : Recruit, train, and manage a team of network engineers and support staff. Provide mentorship, guidance, and performance evaluations to team members. Foster a collaborative and productive work environment. 3.  Strategic Planning : Develop and execute a strategic roadmap for the organization's network infrastructure. Align network initiatives with the company's business goals and objectives. Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to make informed recommendations. 4.  Security and Compliance : Implement and enforce network security policies and best practices. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards. Monitor network traffic for security threats and take appropriate measures to mitigate risks. 5.  Vendor Management : Manage relationships with network hardware and software vendors. Negotiate contracts and service-level agreements. Evaluate and recommend new technologies and solutions. 6.  Budget Management : Develop and manage the network support budget, including capital and operational expenses. Control costs while ensuring the network remains efficient and effective. 7.  Documentation : Maintain accurate and up-to-date network documentation, including diagrams, configurations, and procedures. Ensure that team members follow documentation best practices. Must Have completed any certification course.   Qualifications : Bachelors degree in information technology, Computer Science, Minimum of 7+ years of experience in network support and administration. Strong knowledge of networking protocols, hardware, and software (e.g., FortiGate, Palo Alto, etc.). Strong knowledge of SIEM and VA. Relevant certifications (e.g., CCNA, CCNP, CCIE) are highly desirable. Proven experience in team leadership and management. Excellent communication, problem-solving, and project management skills. Experience : 8+ Years in IT (System Administration)   Candidate from BPO industry or Medical Billing company preferred. Location : Chennai (Velachery)   Work Mode : Office   Notice : Immediate / 30 Days   FOR INTERVIEW CALL -  9150064772 HR    Regards, GLOBAL - HR TEAM 9150064772

column2: Application Developer  ?? The Application Developer is responsible for making available applications and systems which provide the required functionality for IT services.  ?? This includes the development and maintenance of custom applications as well as the customization of products from software vendors. Change Advisory Board  (CAB)   ?? A group of people that advises the Change Manager in the assessment,  prioritization and scheduling of Changes.  ?? This board is usually made up of representatives from all areas within the IT organization,  the business,  and third parties such as suppliers. Change Manager  ?? The Change Manager controls the lifecycle of all Changes.  ?? His primary objective is to enable beneficial Changes to be made,  with minimum disruption to IT services.  ?? For important Changes,  the Change Manager will refer the authorization of Changes to the Change Advisory Board  (CAB) . Configuration Manager  ?? The Configuration Manager is responsible for maintaining information about Configuration Items required to deliver IT services.  ?? To this end he maintains a logical model,  containing the components of the IT infrastructure  (CIs)  and their associations. Emergency Change Advisory Board  (ECAB)   ?? A sub- set of the Change Advisory Board who makes decisions about high impact Emergency Changes.  ?? Membership of the ECAB may be decided at the time a meeting is called,  and depends on the nature of the Emergency Change. Knowledge Manager  ?? The Knowledge Manager ensures that the IT organization is able to gather,  analyze,  store and share knowledge and information.  ?? His primary goal is to improve efficiency by reducing the need to rediscover knowledge. Project Manager  ?? The Project Manager is responsible for planning and coordinating the resources to deploy a major Release within the predicted cost,  time and quality estimates. Release Manager  ?? The Release Manager is responsible for planning and controlling the movement of Releases to test and live environments.  ?? His primary objective is to ensure that the integrity of the live environment is protected and that the correct components are released. Test Manager  ?? The Test Manager ensures that deployed Releases and the resulting services meet customer expectations,  and verifies that IT operations is able to support the new service.
column11: changeIT services, IT infrastructure, Scheduling, Time, IT operations, Advisory, Application, Testing

column2: We are looking for a INFRA MANAGER to produce scalable software solutions. You ll be part of a cross-functional team that s responsible for the full software development life cycle, from conception to deployment.   Required Skills:      Bachelor s Degree (Computer Science or Engineering preferred) or equivalent work experience.      Infrastructure experience and knowledge including a basic understanding of Cloud infrastructure/services and delivery models, storage concepts, networking basics, etc.      Minimum 8-years work experience with at least 4 years of specialized technology project management.      Experience managing resources in a fast moving environment and on projects with evolving requirements and accelerated timelines.      Strong project management skills (organization and time).     Key Responsibilities:      Serve as a single point of contact for all Network / Cloud / infrastructure-related questions and issues.      Support multiple deployment models including manual, scripted, DevOps, CI/CD methodologies.      Participate in the design of Cloud-based infrastructure solutions working alongside Cloud Architects and service domains (e.g., Web, Database, Storage, Networking) to ensure that initial and anticipated future business requirements are represented.      Work with the PMO and Project Manager to define project scope, duration, resource requirements, and costs.      Create a cross-functional infrastructure project plan that encompasses all of the tasks required to build-out/deliver the infrastructure.      This includes dependencies and parallel tasks.      Ensure that the technical artifacts required to implement infrastructure solutions are developed, reviewed and approved.      Work with Information Security ensuring that the proposed infrastructure solution complies with Security Guidelines.      Ensure that all of the different service domains (e.g., Web, Database, Storage, Networking) are delivering their piece.      Serve as a proxy between the different service domains and the client when questions or issues surface.      Initiate ServiceNow requests to the appropriate service domains and technical teams to implement all aspects of the infrastructure build-out/delivery.      Project manage the build-out/delivery, which includes regular follow-up to make sure tasks are implemented per the agreed schedule and work with the team if issues are identified to get them resolved.     Where possible, validate that the infrastructure solution matches the approved design and client environment.      Handover the infrastructure solution to the client for deployment of the application and testing.      Manage all post-handover configuration activities (e.g., account/user management, application registration, certificates, etc.).      Support clients through testing, and where issues are thought to require infrastructure adjustments, work with the project team to make the required changes.     Status reporting throughout the project with appropriate Stakeholders, including meetings as needed to provide a forum for issue/risk identification and remediation, and to progress decisions needed throughout the engagement.      Set, manage and communicate delivery expectations throughout the project.

Network projects often involve implementing changes to existing infrastructure or introducing new technologies. Track project progress, monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), and generate periodic reports for management and stakeholders. column2: A Senior Network Operations Engineer plays a critical role in managing and maintaining an organization's network infrastructure     This role involves overseeing the day-to-day operations of the network, troubleshooting issues, implementing improvements, and ensuring the network's reliability, security, and performance     The Senior Network Operations Engineer is responsible for the design, implementation, maintenance, and optimization of our organization's network infrastructure     This role involves ensuring the network operates efficiently, securely, and with high availability     The Senior Network Operations Engineer collaborates with cross-functional teams to resolve network-related issues and implements best practices for network management             Key Responsibilities:         Network Design and Planning         Design, configure, and implement network solutions to meet the organization's requirements.     Collaborate with architects to plan for network expansion, upgrades, and enhancements.         Network Maintenance and Support         Monitor network performance, troubleshoot issues, and provide timely resolution.     Perform routine maintenance tasks such as firmware updates, patching, and system backups.     Implement security measures to safeguard the network from threats and vulnerabilities.         Network Optimization         Identify areas for network performance improvement and implement optimization strategies.     Analyse network traffic patterns and adjust configurations to enhance efficiency.         Capacity Planning         Evaluate network capacity requirements and plan for scalability.     Forecast and procure necessary hardware and software resources.         Documentation         Maintain accurate and up-to-date network documentation, including diagrams and configurations.     Create and update network policies, procedures, and guidelines.         Collaboration and Communication:         Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, security, and operations, to ensure seamless network operation.     Communicate technical information and network status to non-technical stakeholders.         Incident Response         Respond to network-related incidents and participate in the resolution process.     Implement disaster recovery plans for network failures.         Vendor Management         Work with vendors and service providers in supporting and maintaining network infrastructure.         Shift and On-Call         Work in rostered shift hours. Be available On-Call as per On-Call roster.     Work on planned / unplanned activities during off-shift hours including on weekends.         Experience &      Essential Technical Requirements:         Minimum 10+ years of industry experience in network operations involving LAN, WAN and Wireless technologies.     Experience working in 1000+ devices network infrastructure.     5+ years of experience in Cisco Catalyst and Nexus switching technologies.     5+ years of experience in Cisco ASR and ISR routing platforms.     3+ Years of experience in Wireless network technologies.     In depth knowledge and experience on Cisco ISO and to include routing (OSPF & BGP), switching and QoS.     CCNP certification         Good to have:         Hands-on experience on Software Defined Wide Area Network (SDWAN) on any of the platforms like Viptela /VeloCloud/ Riverbed SteelConnect is an added advantage.     Experience in using monitoring tools like Thousand Eyes, Solarwinds     Experience in working Cisco DNAC, Cisco ISE and Microsoft NPS     ITIL Foundation certification         Educational Qualifications:         Diploma or Degree in any field and passed out in 1st class (>60% or > GPA 7).           What We Can Offer You             Varied, interesting and meaningful work.         A hybrid working environment with flexibility and great opportunities.         Opportunities for training and, as the team grows, career progression or sideways moves.         An opportunity to work within a large global multi-disciplinary consultancy on a mission to change the ways we approach business as usual
column11: ISO, QOS, WAN, Project management, Consulting, LAN, Firmware, microsoft, cisco, OSPF

column2: Purpose & Overall Relevance for the Organization         IT service management is the craft of implementing, managing, and delivering IT services tomeet the needs of the organization. It ensures that the appropriate mix of people, processes,and technology are in place to provide value.         Key Responsibilities         Business analysis         Investigates operational needs and problems, and opportunities, contributing to the recommendation of improvements in automated and non-automated components of new orchanged processes and organisation.   Assists in defining acceptance tests for these recommendations.       Service level management       Monitors service delivery performance metrics and liaises with managers and customers to ensure that service level agreements are not breached without the stakeholders being given the opportunity of planning for a deterioration in service.       Service acceptance       Engages with project management to confirm that products developed meet the service     acceptance criteria and are to the required standard.     Feeds into change management processes.       Change management       Develops, documents and implements changes based on requests for change.     Applies change control procedures.       Release and deployment       Uses the tools and techniques for specific areas of release and deployment activities.     Administers the recording of activities, logging of results and documents technical activity undertaken.      May carry out early life support activities such as providing support advice to initial users.       Problem management       Investigates problems in systems, processes and services.     Assists with the implementation of agreed remedies and preventative measures.     Incident management     Following agreed procedures, identifies, registers and categorises incidents.     Gathers information to enable incident resolution and promptly allocates incidents as appropriate.     Maintains records and advises relevant persons of actions taken.   If required: People Management / Resource Management:   May be involved and gives some input on hiring Transition decisions     Ensures appropriate leadership skills are present at every level through creating a motivational and supportive work environment in which employees are coached, trained and provided with career opportunities through development     Allocates the different work to the respective employees considering experience, complexity,workload and organizational efficiency     Continuously monitors and evaluates team workload and organizational efficiency with the support of IT systems, data and analysis and team feedback and makes appropriate changes   to meet business needs.     Provides team members/direct reports with clear direction and targets that are aligned with   business needs and GIT objectives         Key Relationships         Global IT     Respective business function (GOPS, Finance, HR, Brand Marketing, Wholesale/Retail)     HR Management     Controlling         Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications         Four-year college or university degree with focus on Business Administration or IT or related areas, or equivalent combination of education and experience     Proficient spoken and written command of English     At least 5-year experience in IT     2 years of experience in relevant area     1 year of experience in team management     Understanding of different culture     Participated in projects with people from other functions/markets
column11: IT services, Change management, Service level, Team management, GIT, Business analysis, Project management, Problem management, Resource management, Operations

The Network Technology Analyst will be responsible for evaluating, implementing, and optimizing network technologies to enhance the overall performance and security of our IT infrastructure.      The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of network technologies, strong analytical skills, and a proactive approach to technology evaluation.     Responsibilities : Technology Evaluation : Evaluate emerging network technologies and assess their potential impact on our organization.Conduct feasibility studies and provide recommendations for technology adoption.Proof of Concept (PoC) : Design and execute proof of concept projects for new network technologies.Collaborate with vendors and internal teams to validate technology capabilities.Network Optimization : Analyze existing network infrastructure and identify opportunities for optimization.Implement changes to improve performance, scalability, and efficiency.     Security Assessments : Conduct security assessments on network technologies to identify vulnerabilities.Recommend and implement security measures to mitigate risks.Collaboration with Vendors : Engage with technology vendors to stay informed about product roadmaps and updates.Build and maintain relationships with key vendors for ongoing support.Technical Documentation : Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for network technologies, configurations, and best practices.Develop and update standard operating procedures (SOPs) for technology implementation.Training and Knowledge Sharing : Provide training sessions to IT teams on new network technologies and best practices.Foster knowledge sharing within the organization.Problem Resolution : Assist in troubleshooting complex network issues and incidents.Collaborate with other IT teams to address cross-functional challenges.

column2: Success in the Role: What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?             Analyze and interpret incoming colleague Firewall changes from a security perspective:     Within 30 days of employment, become competent with VMware s Security rules, guidelines, and standard operations.      You will work closely with Engineering, Finance, and internal Cloud operations to provide day-to-day operations support for the Network Security Services portfolio     Within 90 days of employment, you will be deploying new PAN Infrastructure and be responsible to resolve internal customer technical issues through diligent research, reproduction, and troubleshooting.     Within 180 days you will be in a position to work on escalation s, Lead Trouble shoot sessions with PAN TAC and help out on a rotation basis with On call Support.     Within 360 days along with the above, you will be reviewing project requirements and putting together design packages which will be used from a PAN infrastructure deployment perspective. You will be a self-started and lean into to projects until the best solution is found. You will also help define security standard for the entire company.         What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?         Your regular activities may be modified to suit your professional strengths, but you can expect a variety of the following assignments:     Preparation of internal and external firewall changes     Create Change Management workflow s for security changes     Analyze Customer requests and implement the necessary policy changes on the Firewall infrastructure.     Use Visio to represent you design suggests and implementation recommendations.     Assist as an escalation point for remote work VPN issues.     Quickly and accurately communicate the necessary changes needed from a security perspective     Assist with quarterly and annual budgetary costings     Daily you will make hands on changes to our firewall infrastructure.     On a quarterly basis review our implementation flow to see where optimizations and automation can help efficiency.                       The successful candidate will be deploying and troubleshooting Firewall technology daily       They will be using command line, GUI and their scripting skills to achieve this     Wireshark analysis and any other analytical tools can be used for same     As part of a global team, you will have access to the infrastructure North and South of the Security platform giving the successful candidate a really exciting opportunity here to grow     The opportunity for leaning and growth has no celling here     For new deployments the successful candidate will be responsible to document and share that knowledge with the global team     You will be responsible to install, configure, manage, maintain, and support security production services for Internal and External Customers     You will be also involved in planning for disaster recovery, other backup contingencies, diagnose and troubleshoot services, software, and other network services related problems     You will also assist with coordinating between different teams for smoother 24/7 day to day technical operations and executions     You will be primarily responsible for the installation, configuration, and maintenance of all the Palo Alto Networks Firewalls infrastructure     Furthermore, you will be required to perform all PAN Firewall operations to include creating NAT Polices, Security Firewall rules changes, Trouble shoot PAN GP issues and many more functions     You should possess expert knowledge of TCP/IP, IP routing, LAN and WAN protocols, campus and data center switching     The team is distributed across and works from different parts of the Globe     The team follow Dynamic, Open culture at work and encourages to learn from others, teach others and grow along with others while being collaborative and courteous

column2: A Network Engineer is a professional who designs, implements, manages, and maintains computer networks within an organization     They are responsible for ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of network infrastructure, including routers, switches, firewalls, servers, and other networking devices       Here are some key responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the role of a Network Engineer:       Network Design and Planning: Designing and planning network architecture based on business requirements     Network Engineers assess network needs, select appropriate technologies and hardware, and create network diagrams and documentation     Network Implementation and Configuration: Deploying and configuring network equipment such as routers, switches, firewalls, and load balancers     Network Engineers ensure proper connectivity, security, and optimal performance by configuring IP addresses, VLANs, routing protocols, and access control lists     Network Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Monitoring network performance and troubleshooting network issues     Network Engineers use network monitoring tools to identify and resolve network outages, latency issues, or bottlenecks     They analyze network traffic patterns, perform packet captures, and investigate security incidents     Network Security: Implementing and maintaining network security measures to protect against unauthorized access, data breaches, and cyber threats     Network Engineers configure firewalls, VPNs (Virtual Private Networks), and intrusion detection/prevention systems     They conduct security assessments and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations     Network Maintenance and Upgrades: Performing regular network maintenance tasks, including firmware upgrades, patch management, and hardware replacements     Network Engineers collaborate with vendors and service providers to schedule maintenance windows and minimize disruptions to network services
column11: Patch management, Network design, Networking, Intrusion detection, Network security, network services, Hardware, Windows, Firmware, Network maintenance

column2: Dolat Capital, a technology-driven quantitative trading firm, is looking to hire a network engineer to design, implement and support low latency trading network technology and solutions. The role will focus around co-Location networks, including client, exchange and vendor connectivity across Mumbai region.     As a Network Engineer, you will be working on the organization s production network infrastructure, your mission will be to ensure the network is always fast (low latency), available, scalable and engineered to withstand unparalleled outages. You will be working in a team that combines network engineering, operations, system administration, and develop automation tools to enhance and operate our firm s network platform. This is your chance to make a change, and transform our way of working with automation and scale.       Responsibilities         Network Design; configure switches and routers; emphasis on complex multicast traffic.     Layout data centers; we have a complex WAN and LAN with about 4 data centers. Benchmark technology components to determine their latency and bandwidth. Knowledge of Installation and Troubleshooting of Routers, Switches & Firewall     Knowledge of Cisco, Arista, Dell Force 10     Knowledge of Microsoft Office products including Outlook, Excel, and Word.     Excellent communication skills.     We hire for Aptitude, Character, and Enthusiasm. We are looking for associates who are eager to learn and move up as the firm grows.     Strong Network Engineering/Support knowledge.     Good understanding of Unicast and Multicast LAN/WAN using EIGRP. OSPF, BGP, PIM-SM and IGMP     Good Co-Location skills: exchange/connectivity/campus     Good vendor technology knowledge: Cisco and Arista     Ideally worked in a Low Latency trading environment (low latency WAN)     Ability to not only troubleshoot complex problems but also to manage projects, design solutions and deliver technology implementations. Strong knowledge of network fundamentals (TCP/IP, ARP, IP Tables, routing).     Excellent analytical skills, coupled with a strong sense of responsibility, urgency and drive.     Experience with network security, including firewalls Fortinet/Palo Alto/CheckPoint would be a plus

column2: RSA Archer is a widely used enterprise governance, risk management, and compliance (GRC) platform developed by RSA, a subsidiary of Dell Technologies      It provides organizations with a centralized and integrated approach to managing various aspects of risk, compliance, and business operations      Key features and functionalities of RSA Archer include:        Risk Management:        RSA Archer allows organizations to identify, assess, and prioritize risks across the enterprise      It enables the implementation of risk management frameworks, facilitates risk assessments, and tracks risk mitigation activities      Compliance Management: The platform helps organizations streamline compliance processes by providing tools to document and track regulatory requirements, monitor compliance activities, and manage compliance assessments and certifications      Policy Management: RSA Archer enables organizations to establish and enforce policies by providing a centralized repository for policies, procedures, and controls      It supports policy creation, approval workflows, and monitoring of policy adherence      Incident Management: The platform helps organizations effectively manage incidents by providing a system for reporting, tracking, and investigating incidents      It enables incident response workflows, tracks remediation activities, and facilitates reporting and analysis      Vendor Risk Management: RSA Archer allows organizations to assess and manage risks associated with third-party vendors      It provides tools for vendor due diligence, risk assessments, contract management, and ongoing monitoring of vendor performance      Business Continuity Management: The platform supports business continuity planning and management by enabling organizations to develop and test business continuity plans, track recovery efforts, and assess the potential impact of disruptions      Audit Management: RSA Archer facilitates the planning, execution, and tracking of audit activities      It supports audit planning, issue tracking, and reporting, and provides visibility into the status and results of audits across the organization      Reporting and Analytics: The platform offers robust reporting and analytics capabilities, allowing organizations to generate customized reports, dashboards, and visualizations      It provides insights into risk and compliance metrics, trends, and performance indicators      Workflow and Automation: RSA Archer enables organizations to streamline processes and automate repetitive tasks      It supports the creation of workflows, task assignments, notifications, and approvals, improving efficiency and reducing manual effort

column2: The Infrastructure Specialist is a professional who leads the effort to enhance, uplift and standardize the existing MIS infrastructure with focus on zero outage, cloud first strategy, management through SLAs / KPIs        He would be required to digitize monitoring systems system processes, with an approach to use techniques for automation, alerting and auto healing      The objective is to increase system availability, improve throughput system efficiency and achieve Zero Downtimes        The Infrastructure Specialist is expected to work along with the to focus on maximizing the effectiveness of system availability, ease of end user system use, with an intent for minimal manual intervention / steps      He would need to work with operational teams, workgroups and communities to ensure that the digital processes, applications and services they use regularly are optimal           This person does so by:            Developing resiliency on systems which have single points of failure.          Developing digital mechanisms of notification and alerting for proactive action and safeguarding committed SLAs.          Develop techniques to automate processes which are manual for easing user and system actions, like email creation / deletion, asset management (IMAC), conference room booking etc.          Develop bots to ensure auto healing of systems, like failover of processes, systems and link paths.          Testing emerging technologies like AI Service Desk, DevSecOps, Docker, Kubernetes etc              5 7 years of work experience, preferably in business or IT management and ideally a combination of the two. column2: As an RPA Blue Prism Developer, your role involves designing, developing, and implementing automation solutions using the Blue Prism platform      Solution Design: You work closely with business analysts and stakeholders to understand the automation requirements and design solutions using the Blue Prism platform      This involves analyzing existing processes, identifying automation opportunities, and creating process flow diagrams and solution design documents      Process Automation Development: Using the Blue Prism platform, you develop and configure automation workflows, known as process flows or "robots," to mimic human interactions and perform the desired tasks      This includes creating and managing process objects, defining data inputs and outputs, and integrating with other systems or applications      RPA Development Best Practices: As an RPA Blue Prism Developer, you follow best practices and coding standards specific to the Blue Prism platform      This ensures the reliability, maintainability, and scalability of automation solutions      You optimize and enhance process flows to improve efficiency and adhere to performance standards      Testing and Debugging: You conduct rigorous testing of the automation solutions to ensure they function as intended      This involves unit testing, integration testing, and end-to-end testing of the automated processes      You identify and fix any bugs or issues that arise during testing, ensuring the quality and accuracy of the automation      Solution Deployment: Once the automation solution is developed and tested, you deploy it to the production environment      You collaborate with infrastructure teams and follow deployment processes to ensure a smooth transition and integration with existing systems or workflows
column11: Process automation, Solution design, Business Analyst, Scalability, Coding, Debugging, Integration testing, Infrastructure, Deployment, Unit testing

column2: About Fivesky:     We design,  deploy,  and maintain advanced technologies that enable our customers to achieve operational excellence at substantial OpEx savings. Our core strengths include a concentration on networks,  their security & optimization with a laser focus on redefining the fulfillment experience.      In addition to our core focus in IT security,  Fivesky provides our employees a dynamic environment to learn and grow professionally. Your peers will be senior engineers with specialized expertise in all areas critical to IT environments,  including networking,  storage,  security,  cloud,  enterprise applications,  servers,  messaging and virtualization. We are a team of driven professionals that are committed to our customers success and delivering the highest quality of service.      Fivesky s reputation,  resources and culture empower talented Senior Network Security Operations Administrator to succeed.       Job Description      We are looking for a highly motivated and talented Senior Network Security Operations Administrator to join a fast- paced,  dynamic and challenging environment.      The ideal candidate must demonstrate conceptual understanding of Network Security and the ability to work in a global team environment. S/ he should have a natural curiosity and initiate interest to focus on IT security products and technologies. The Candidate is also responsible to provide assistance in maintaining and administering the global security infrastructure and email gateway of the company      As the Senior Network Security Operations Administrator,  your responsibilities will include,  but are not limited to,  the following:        Level 3 operational buttress for Network Security Products & Services such as Firewalls(Juniper/ Fortinet),  Email (Proofpoint/ Sendmail/ Postfix),  Internet web Proxies,  SOCKS and FTP proxies,  Malware Protection,  Intrusion Detection Systems, Network Access Control,  System management(Micromuse Netcool,  Empire Sysedge,  SNMP),  Network Behavior Analysis; DDOS Tools,  etc.      Endow operational support which includes Deployment,  configuration,  advanced troubleshooting and coordinate with the Engineering and Vendor support teams       Monitor every products and services to perpetuate a salubrious Infrastructure      Steer all sort of technology problems and incidents with proper coordination      Engage in weekly/ monthly calls with the customers       Forge and enhance Operational Runbooks and set global strategies with regional desideratum and insistence      Edify the team members and communicate with various teams(networking,  systems,  e- business and PC support) in all major regions across the orb       This is a full- time,  direct employment in Bengaluru,  Karnataka. Salary is open based on experience & qualifications.      Qualifications:      3 years of network security administration in an environment of more than 100 servers,  with more than 100 users and more than 1 operating system.      Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree in Information Technology,  Computer Science or a related discipline.      Skills & Experiences:    Must possess strong conceptual knowledge and demonstrate in- depth understanding of the following:      Packet filtering,  stateful packet inspection and its difference      Routing,  switching,  VLANs,  VPNS,  NIS,  NFS.      Linux System admin skills (Red Hat Enterprise Linux)      Scripting Languages(Shell, perl,  Python)      Antimalware systems and network security management platforms(Lancope,  RedSeal,  Tufin).      Firewall enterprise management(Juniper NSM,  Juniper SPACE, Juniper Netscreen,  SRX,  Palo Alto) and Fortigate(manage 400 firewalls)      Packet capture and analysis using snoop,  tcpdump and Ethereal or similar tools.      Host Security(passwords,  uids/ gids,  SIDs,  file permissions,  ACLs,  file system integrity,  use of security packages,  IPTables)      Routing protocols (BGP,  OSPF,  RIP,  etc)      Load balancing devices: F5 BIG- IP,  A10      Interpersonal Skills:      Must be able to demonstrate troubleshooting skills.      Good knowledge in IT security      Strong presentation and written skills.      Strong interpersonal,  organizational and communication skills      Independent problem- solving,  highly motivated and self- directing.      Should be self- driven and flexible      Ability to multi- task and handle multiple projects      Practice tolerance and professionalism throughout the tough time        Benefits:    At Fivesky,  our employees are our greatest asset and the focal point around which we operate,  therefore,  we always want the best for our employees. In addition to offering competitive compensation plans and long- term career opportunities. We offer an attractive mix of benefit plans to our employees that include: provisions for vacation,  holiday pay,  and sick days.       Fivesky is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regard to race,  sex,  age,  color,  religion,  national origin,  veteran status,  disability,  genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law.

column2: We are seeking an experienced and knowledgeable Senior Network Security Consultant to join our cybersecurity team      The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of network security technologies, threat mitigation strategies, and best practices      As a Senior Network Security Consultant, you will play a critical role in providing expert guidance to clients, assessing security risks, and designing solutions to protect their network infrastructure        Responsibilities:        Lead and oversee complex network security projects, including architecture design, implementation, and optimization      Provide strategic and technical consulting to clients, identifying security vulnerabilities and recommending effective solutions      Conduct thorough security assessments and audits of network environments to identify weaknesses and potential risks      Design, implement, and maintain network security solutions such as firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, VPNs, and access control systems      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate security solutions into the overall network architecture      Stay updated on the latest security threats, vulnerabilities, and industry trends to provide proactive recommendations      Analyze security incidents, conduct forensic investigations, and assist in incident response efforts      Develop and deliver comprehensive security assessment reports to clients, detailing findings and recommended actions      Assist in the development of security policies, standards, and procedures to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements      Mentor and provide guidance to junior consultants on security best practices and technical skills      Participate in client presentations, workshops, and training sessions on network security topics        Qualifications:        Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field; column2: Designation: Team Lead IT Infra Job Code: JD2208206   No. of vacancies: 1 Experience: 6 to 10 years Location: Chennai (Guindy) Shift: General Job Description:   Position Overview : We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated professional to join our company as a Team Lead for our Operation Support Centre. As the Team Lead, you will be entrusted with the responsibility of overseeing and leading a dedicated team of systems administrators, database administrators, and Linux administrators. Your primary focus will be on ensuring the smooth operation and optimal performance of our 24*7 IT infrastructure services. This role requires exceptional leadership skills, technical expertise in systems administration or database and Linux administration, as well as excellent communication abilities.  Familiar with the following technologies: 2) Virtualization 3) Firewalls Security 4) Backup Processes 5) Windows Servers and OS 6) O365 Resource Responsibilities: Overall management of the infrastructure 250 Employees 2 Data Centers Azure DR setup & subscription maintenance O365 Mail server maintenance 5 Offices Server Maintenance Daily monitoring of the performance of all infrastructure activities Review issues with user desktops. Manage the vendors. Help desktop support team with troubleshooting. Review the activities of the desktop support team. Key Responsibilities:  Lead a team of cross skilled Database, Linux and System administrators (i.e. windows, FTP, AD, IAM, SCOM, SCCM), working on 24*7 environment.  Oversee the daily business operations, ensuring seamless delivery withing defined SLAs and operational processes.  Work with HR team to identify and onboard resources. Facilitate knowledge transfer to the new team members. Track and document the progress.  Evaluate performance of the team members based on predefined KPIs, identify problem areas, and lead the mitigation plans. Setup individual goals and carry out period review. Participate and present the service status in regular review calls, work with the team and management for continuous improvement.  Work as the point of contact for escalations, lead troubleshooting calls when required while ensuring quality of resolution.  Build a positive and collaborative team culture, promoting knowledge sharing, professional growth, and innovation. Encourage cross-skilling and effective communication within the team and with other stakeholders.  Lead the team in effectively handling incidents and problems, ensuring timely resolution, root cause analysis, and preventive measures. Implement pre-defined incident, change and problem management processes to minimize downtime and disruptions.  Maintain strong relationships with stakeholders, including internal teams and external clients, providing regular updates on system operations, service levels, and escalations. Serve as the primary point of contact for operational inquiries and ensure customer satisfaction.  Required Skills:  Education and Work experience: You should have a bachelor's degree, preferably in IT with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience.  Expert level understanding of ITIL processes. Certified candidates shall be preferred.  Strong Leadership: Proven experience in leading and managing technical teams, with the ability to inspire, motivate, and develop team members.  Technical Expertise: In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience in either of systems administration, DB or Linux administration, with proficiency in troubleshooting, performance optimization, and security best practices. Shall be willing and capable of learning new technologies.  Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Strong interpersonal skills to foster effective collaboration and build positive relationships.  Problem-solving Abilities: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically, make sound decisions, and resolve issues in a fast-paced environment. Continuous Learning: A passion for staying updated with the latest industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in systems administration, database, and Linux administration.  If you are a highly skilled and motivated professional with a strong technical background in at least one of the technologies mentioned, coupled with exceptional leadership and excellent communication skills, we invite you to join our team as a Team Lead for our Operation Support Centre.

column2: Diverse Lynx is looking for NOC Engg to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Network Operations Center (NOC) Engineer to join our dynamic IT team. The NOC Engineer will be responsible for monitoring network performance, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring the overall health and stability of our IT infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and communication skills, along with experience in network operations.     Responsibilities : Network Monitoring : Monitor network infrastructure using network monitoring tools to detect and respond to incidents.Analyze alerts, logs, and performance metrics to identify potential issues.Incident Management : Respond to incidents and service requests escalated to the NOC in a timely manner.Troubleshoot and resolve network-related issues, escalating when necessary.     Documentation : Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation related to network configurations, procedures, and incident resolutions.Develop and update standard operating procedures (SOPs) for NOC activities.Communication : Communicate with internal teams, vendors, and stakeholders to coordinate incident response and resolution.Provide clear and concise updates during incidents and outages.     Performance Analysis : Analyze network performance trends and report on capacity planning and optimization recommendations.Implement changes to improve network performance.Collaboration : Collaborate with other IT teams, including network engineers, system administrators, and security teams, to address complex issues.Participate in shift handovers and share knowledge with team members.Security Monitoring : Contribute to security monitoring activities and assist in responding to security incidents.Work with security teams to implement and enforce security policies.Proactive Maintenance : Conduct routine checks and preventive maintenance tasks to ensure the reliability of network equipment.Implement changes during maintenance windows to minimize impact.

column2: Description :     The Network Engineers role is to ensure the stability and integrity of in-house voice, data, video, and wireless network services. This is achieved by planning, designing, and developing local area networks (LANs) and wide area networks (WANs) across the organization. In addition, the Network Engineer will participate with the installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and optimization of all network hardware, software, and communication links. This individual will also analyze and resolve network hardware and software problems in a timely and accurate fashion, and provide end user training. Network engineer will also participate in Linux servers configurations and management tasks       Responsibilities :     Monitoring network performance and ensure system availability and reliability   Configuring and installing various network devices and services (e.g., routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers, VPN, QoS)   Setup and Configuration Cisco ASA firewalls   Configure Site to Site vpn, NAT, Access Rules, URL Filtering, Bandwidth Management and monitoring, Service policy rules, Dual ISP connection, Failover on Cisco ASA firewalls   Research and make recommendations on server system administration   Performing network maintenance and system upgrades including service packs, patches, hotfixes and security configurations   Monitor system resource utilization, trending, and capacity planning   Provide Level-2/3 support and troubleshooting to resolve issues   Work within established configuration and change management policies to ensure awareness, approval and success of changes made to the network infrastructure   Select and implement security tools, policies, and procedures in conjunction with the company?s security team   Liaise with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution   Must Have Skills :   Proven hands-on network engineering experience   CCNP or higher (CCIE and/or CISSP highly valued)   Deep understanding of networking protocols (e.g., IPSEC, HSRP, BGP, OSPF, 802.11, QoS)   Solid understanding of the OSI or TCP/IP model   Experience on configuration of Cisco Firewalls, Manageable Switches and Routers.   Hands-on experience with monitoring, network diagnostic and network analytics tools       Good to have :     Hands on experience on Linux server configuration and management   University degree in Computer Science or a related subject   Experience on Linux Shell script   Experience on monitoring system performance and troubleshooting issues       ISMS Role and Responsibilities:     Adhere to information security policies and processes of organization to protect business data and assets   Understanding and reporting on information security risks using risk assessment and treatment methodologies for the impact on confidentiality, integrity and availability of business data   Understanding of systems configuration, hardening, patch management and deployment   Understanding of systems backups and restoration to protect the business data from any disaster events   Provisioning and de-provisioning logical access to information processing systems (such as network and servers) as authorized   Implementing appropriate physical and technical safeguards at network and computing systems level, to protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of business data   Understanding and reporting on how business data is stored, processed and transmitted by the organization and by third-party vendors (as applicable)   Report actual or suspected security and/or policy violations/breaches to an appropriate authority

column2: Essenware Private Limted is looking for Senior Network Engineer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     The Senior Network Engineer is a highly skilled professional responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining an organization's network infrastructure     This role involves leading network-related projects, providing technical expertise, and ensuring the stability, security, and efficiency of the network environment     The Senior Network Engineer collaborates with cross-functional teams to support business objectives and maintain a robust and reliable network infrastructure     Key Responsibilities:Network Design and Implementation:Design and deploy complex network solutions to meet business requirements     Plan and execute network upgrades, expansions, and migrations     Evaluate and recommend new networking technologies and solutions     Network Security:Implement and maintain network security protocols, firewalls, and intrusion detection/prevention systems     Monitor network traffic for any suspicious activity and take appropriate measures to mitigate security threats     Conduct regular security assessments and audits to ensure compliance with security policies and industry standards     Network Troubleshooting and Support:Diagnose and resolve complex network issues to minimize downtime and optimize network performance     Provide technical support to junior network engineers and helpdesk teams     Participate in an on-call rotation to address network emergencies and incidents     Network Performance Monitoring and Optimization:Monitor network performance and bandwidth utilization to identify and resolve bottlenecks     Conduct regular performance tuning to optimize network efficiency     Implement Quality of Service (QoS) policies to prioritize critical network traffic     Vendor Management:Collaborate with vendors and service providers to ensure the timely delivery of network services and equipment     Manage vendor relationships, negotiate contracts, and evaluate service level agreements (SLAs)     Documentation and Reporting:Create and maintain detailed network documentation, including network diagrams, configurations, and change logs     Generate periodic reports on network performance, security, and capacity     Network Capacity Planning:Analyze network traffic patterns and plan for future network expansion and upgrades     Forecast capacity requirements to meet the organization's growth needs     Compliance and Regulations:Ensure the network infrastructure adheres to relevant industry regulations and compliance standards     Participate in audits and assessments to demonstrate compliance with security and regulatory requirements

column2: Job Summary:  The Network and WiFi Administrator is responsible for the planning, implementation, management, and maintenance of the organizations network infrastructure and wireless systems. This role ensures reliable, high-performance network connectivity to support the organization's operations and strategic goals.  Key Responsibilities:  Network Infrastructure Management:  Design, configure, and manage the organizations LAN, WAN, and VPN.  Monitor network performance and reliability, ensuring optimal operation.  Troubleshoot and resolve network issues promptly to minimize downtime.  WiFi Network Management:  Oversee the deployment and management of wireless networks to ensure comprehensive coverage and performance.  Implement and manage WiFi security protocols to protect against unauthorized access.  Monitor and analyze WiFi network usage and performance, optimizing configurations as necessary. Network Security:  Develop and enforce network security policies and procedures.  Implement and manage firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and other security measures.  Conduct regular security assessments and vulnerability testing to identify and mitigate risks.  Capacity Planning and Upgrades:  Conduct network capacity planning to anticipate future needs and ensure scalability.  Plan and oversee network upgrades, expansions, and enhancements.  Evaluate new technologies and recommend improvements to the network infrastructure.  Vendor and Contract Management:  Manage relationships with network and WiFi vendors and service providers.  Oversee procurement of network equipment and services, ensuring cost-effective solutions.  Negotiate and manage service contracts and agreements.  Team Leadership and Training:   Lead and mentor the network administration team, providing guidance and support.  Develop and deliver training programs for IT staff on network management and security best practices.  Ensure the team stays current with emerging network technologies and industry trends.  Documentation and Reporting:  Maintain comprehensive documentation of network configurations, processes, and procedures.  Generate regular reports on network performance, security incidents, and capacity utilization.  Provide recommendations for network improvements and upgrades.  Qualifications:  Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.  3 years of experience in network administration.  Strong technical knowledge of network infrastructure, including routers, switches, firewalls, and wireless access points.  Proficiency in network management tools and technologies (e.g., Cisco, Juniper, Ubiquiti).  Experience with network security protocols and best practices.  Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.  Certifications such as CCNP, CCIE, or equivalent are highly desirable.  Key Competencies:  Technical expertise in network and WiFi systems.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  Attention to detail and ability to work under pressure
column11: Network Infrastructure Management, WiFi Network Management, Capacity Planning, Network Security, Network Administration

column2: The Manager - IT Infrastructure is responsible for overseeing and managing the organization's information technology infrastructure, ensuring its stability, reliability, and security     This role involves leading a team of IT professionals and collaborating with other departments to ensure the effective operation of all IT systems, networks, and infrastructure components     Key Responsibilities:Strategy and Planning:Develop and implement strategic plans for the organization's IT infrastructure to meet current and future business needs     Evaluate and recommend new technologies, tools, and systems to enhance the IT infrastructure and optimize operations     Collaborate with senior management and stakeholders to align IT infrastructure initiatives with organizational goals     Infrastructure Management:Manage the day-to-day operations of the IT infrastructure, including servers, networks, storage systems, and data centers     Ensure high availability, reliability, and performance of infrastructure components through proactive monitoring, maintenance, and capacity planning     Implement and maintain security measures to protect the organization's IT infrastructure and data from unauthorized access or breaches     Team Leadership and Development:Lead and manage a team of IT professionals, including hiring, training, mentoring, column2: We at Insight are hiring  "LCS Consultant"  with 5+ years of industry experience in SAP  Licensing. Job Location- Delhi NCR/ Bangalore/Hyderabad Work mode- Hybrid    Job Description   License Consulting Services The LCS Consultant resides within the License Consulting Services area of EMEA Services function. The LCS Consultant is responsible for providing consultancy support to Insights clients, acting as a key resource for LCS managed services across the software lifecycle to deliver a wide variety of licensing solutions.     Provide technical implementation, configuration, and tool analysis services to clients for Software Asset Management (SAM), compliance and optimisation solutions. Adopt a proactive approach to engaging with local account teams to build an understanding of the client requirements and help drive the delivery of solutions. Analyse and process client data to perform licensing reconciliation services, data quality assessments, and review of licensing agreements and usage rights. Utilise knowledge of software licensing to support Insights EMEA wide licensing desk, internal teammate queries and any client questions regarding licensing. Support internal Sales teammates to ensure the efficient delivery of LCS to clients. Acts as a technical pre-sales advisor to account managers and sales associates.   Requirement:   Primary Skills:  Proven track record of delivering SAP License Optimization projects User Analysis, Contract Optimization, Indirect Access Analysis, etc. Knowledge of SAP Audit procedures, SAP LAW, USMM, SAP for Me, LMBI, Digital Access and HANA reports.  Experience with ECC-> S/4 HANA license conversions On Premise or Cloud (RISE) Secondary Skills: Knowledge of key optimization tools like Snow, Flexera, Voquz, Aspera, ServiceNow Preferable a consulting background and experience of leading licensing projects from inception to completion Strong communication skills with the ability to interact effectively with teammates Knowledge of  licensing models  for one or more software publishers Working knowledge of a  SAM tool (Flexera, SNOW or Aspera) IT and Licensing knowledge for at least one software publisher Experience of  IT tools (Microsoft SCCM,ServiceNow or SQL scripting) Fully conversant with Microsoft Officesuite (Outlook, Excel, and Word) Experience of working within a statutory legal and/or regulatory framework Proven experience in presenting results ofanalyses Ability to interpret multiple data sets and summarise key points, highlighting methods used, expectations, issues,trends, observations, and recommendations Experience of working within a globally diverse environment, showing an understanding of and keen interest in equality, diversity, and inclusion Ability to execute proof of concepts and product demonstrations to internal and external stakeholders at a variety of levels Ability to simplify and explain complex issues to a range of audiences Experience of implementing the technical aspects of  SAM tools Excellent time management skills and ability to work unsupervised, to tight deadlines

column2: The Network System Administrator is responsible for monitoring and managing the local and wide area networks of an organization to ensure maximum uptime and performance for users. The role can include system configurations, documenting and managing the installation of new networks, and maintaining and upgrading existing systems as necessary.       ACCOUNTABILITIES & ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS         Monitoring and installation of various network devices and services (eg routers & switches, Palo Alto firewalls, Arista & Aruba switches, access points).     Perform network maintenance and system upgrades including service packs, patches, and security configurations.     Monitor performance and ensure system availability and reliability using tools such as Solar Winds & Pager Duty.     Knowledge of Switch security, firewall zoning, routing protocols, firewall management & structured cabling.     Monitor system resource utilization, trending, and capacity planning.     Knowledge of WAN, MPLS and VPN services.     Knowledge of LAN, cabling, racking, and mounting.     Monitoring and analysing of logs.     Work within network team for configuration and change management policies to ensure awareness, approval and success of changes made to the network infrastructure.     Liaise with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution.     Maximising network performance through ongoing monitoring and troubleshooting.     Arranging scheduled upgrades & investigating faults in the network.     Updating network equipment to the latest firmware releases.Assist with ensuring networks are secure and available at all times.         SKILLS & CERTIFICATIONS         Knowledge of Palo Alto Firewall, and Aruba & Arista switches, WIFI.     Ability to communicate effectively with a wide variety of people in a professional manner, face to face, on the telephone and in writing.     Willing to work flexibly and with enthusiasm.      Hands on experience in networking, routing, and switching     Knowledge of best practices around management, control, and monitoring of server infrastructure     Experience with firewalls, troubleshooting of network issue, monitoring of network infrastructure and problem resolution is desired.     Take lead on critical issues and escalate it to appropriate teams and management if required.     Fosters a learning environment and mentors Network Administrators.     Follow up on pending tickets/tasks with other teams and take appropriate action.     Create knowledge base articles and publish them.     Expert in configuring and installation various network devices and services (eg routers & switches, Palo Alto firewalls, Arista & Aruba switches).     Expert in switch security, firewall zoning, routing protocols, firewall management & structured cabling.     Ensure networks are secure and available at all times         Requirements         Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or a related field.     4+ years relevant experience required. For internal candidates, experience can be a combination of internal and external experience.     Certification in 2+ relevant network technologies (switching, routing, design, automation, cloud, security etc

column2: NXP Semiconductors     enables secure connections and infrastructure for a smarter world, advancing solutions that make lives easier, better and safer       As the world leader in secure connectivity solutions for embedded applications, we are driving innovation in the secure connected vehicle, end-to-end security privacy and smart connected solutions markets                Your new role        As part of the global role, work closely with cross-functional teams, including IT operations, infrastructure, and application teams, to implement security controls and address security requirements     Design, configure, and maintain Palo Alto Networks firewall solutions to protect our network infrastructure from external threats.     Configure and maintain Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect VPN solution to provide secure remote access for employees, contractors, and partners.     Deploy and manage Palo Alto Networks Prisma Access solution to secure remote access and ensure secure connectivity for our distributed workforce.     Develop and enforce network security policies to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices.     Show ownership and drive issues to conclusion including post-mortem phase, identifying root causes and improvement actions.     Stay up-to-date with the latest network security technologies, trends, and threats. Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement security enhancements proactively.           What you will need to succeed        Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.     5+ years profound knowledge and experience in working in an Enterprise Network infrastructure.     Expert level engineering knowledge in designing, implementing, and managing Palo Alto firewalls, Prisma Access, GlobalProtect, and proxy solutions.     Experience managing and maintaining a firewall inspection VPC in an AWS environment, including expertise in configuring and optimizing security groups, network access control lists (NACLs), route tables, and other relevant AWS networking components.     Ability to evaluate connectivity products and offer IT network solutions in line with security guidelines:      Common IT network Security knowledge (Firewalls / 802.1x)     Common IT WAN/LAN experience (Cisco LAN and Datacenter LAN)     Common IT DDIN (DNS/DHCP/NTP)     Common network tooling understanding         Experience understanding of Terraform, Cloudformation, Ansible, REST API and similar DevOps coding and concepts.     Familiar with SAFe Agile Framework and way of working.     You have an entrepreneurial mindset, you overcome challenges being decisive and accept responsibility for your outcomes.     Constant desire to improve the status quo and improve your skills, learn from your mistakes and take continuous action on your ideas.     Thorough analytic and problem-solving skills, with the ability to assess complex problems and propose practical solutions     Work under pressure to meet customer network needs with quality, and in a timely manner and expected to respond after hours.

Your responsibilities will involve administering the organizations servers, workstations and mobile devices, as well as ensuring that the email and data storage networks are working effectively.              You will also be responsible for ensuring that employees workstations are working efficiently and the same stay connected to the central computer network. Tech / B.E                                    Experience: Minimum 2 Years of experience as an IT and Network Administrator                              Responsibilities and Duties                          Identify the network hardware and software to meet the requirements of the organisation. CCNA, CCNP and any network related certifications will be an added advantage.            In-depth understanding of firewall configuration

column2: Network Operations Analyst is responsible to manage the global network services operations ensuring the stability, performance, resiliency, security, and efficiency of our organizations global network infrastructure. This role encompasses several critical responsibilities, the key responsibilities: Manage Operations and Execution: - Service Delivery: Ensure that services are delivered according to defined criteria, contracts, and financial agreements. Monitor performance metrics, address bottlenecks, and optimize processes. - Incident Management: Handle incidents promptly, minimizing downtime and impact on users. Collaborate with technical teams to resolve issues efficiently. - Continuous Improvement: Implement best practices, streamline workflows, and enhance operational efficiency. Regularly assess processes and adapt as needed. Compliance and Auditability: - Policy Adherence: Ensure that the network operations team adheres to organizational policies, industry standards, and legal requirements. Regularly review and update policies. - Process Compliance: Monitor process adherence across the network. Conduct internal audits to identify gaps and recommend corrective actions. - Configuration Management: Maintain accurate records of network configurations, changes, and updates. Implement version control and change management practices. Key Job Responsibilities 1.   Network Infrastructure Maintenance and management: a. Oversee and Manage Global Network Services and Systems: b. - Responsible for maintaining and managing a comprehensive suite of global network services and systems, including SDWAN, LAN, WLAN, Zero Trust Architecture, micro-segmentations, Network Access Control (NAC), IT, OT, LAB networks, cloud networking on AWS and VMC platforms, firewalls, and B2B VPNs. c. - The primary goal is to ensure standardization, security, resilience, scalability, performance, and reliability of the network infrastructure and integration solutions. d. Network Operations and Troubleshooting: e. - Manage global network operations, addressing various operational issues related to network services. f. - Utilize ITIL practices to troubleshoot and resolve network-related challenges. g. Enhancing Network Stability and Resilience: h. - Drive initiatives to enhance network stability, ensuring service resilience, disaster recovery (DR), and technology upgrades for network services. i. Alignment with Business Objectives and Technology Standards: j. - Ensure that the overall network infrastructure stability aligns with business objectives and industry technology standards. k. Comprehensive Blueprint and Documentation: l. - Maintain a detailed blueprint of the IT network infrastructure, covering networks, cloud components, and critical elements. m. - Design changes should align with organizational needs and future growth and enterprize architecture principles. n. - Detailed documentation facilitates troubleshooting and future updates. o. Continuous Learning and Innovation: p. - Stay informed about emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices related to network infrastructure architecture. q. Provide innovative recommendations for network solutions. 2.   Stable & Secure foundations: a. Minimized Business Disruption: b. - Despite large-scale changes, ensured minimal business disruption during outages. c. - Prepair and exceute holistic plan to reduce Priority 1 incidents for network services. d. - Drive P1 incident with different stackholders to identify root cause and fix e. - Work on lesson learnt and preventive actions to avoid P1 incident in futuer. f. Obsolescence Management: g. - Mantain and manage network asset life cycle of network hardware and software  h. - Drive network Hardware and software refresh program to keep network infrastructure upto date. i. Cybersecurity Strengthening: j. - Deploy network segmentation, Zero Trust Network Access (NAC), to secure the network. k. - Deploy zero trust architecture and Network standardization across global sites l. FMEA for Critical Solutions/Services: m. - Created and maintained Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) for critical solutions/services. n. - Strong operational risk management with structured follow up on mitigation measures o. Resilience Testing: p. - Ensured resilience for all critical services to be built and tested. q. Vulnerability Management: r. - Identify and address potential risks and vulnerabilities in the network infrastructure design, implementing appropriate security measures and disaster recovery plans. s. - Continuously worked to reduce vulnerability levels. 3.   Vendor and Stakeholder Management a. Regularly compare performance and mindset against market alternatives. b. Vendor Selection and Infrastructure Acquisition: c. - Evaluate and choose vendors for network infrastructure products and services. d. - Acquire necessary hardware and software. e. Continuous Learning and Innovation: f. - Stay informed about emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in network infrastructure architecture. g. - Recommend innovative solutions. h. Alignment with Stakeholders: i. - Align strategy and roadmap with internal and external stakeholders. j. - Provide periodic updates on project status and delivery. k. - Communicate business impact during severe service disruptions. l. Effective Audit Management: l. - Ensured timely closure of audits actions for network related findings. m. - No repeat findings for high-risk areas. column2: A Network Engineer is a professional who designs, implements, manages, and maintains computer networks within an organization      They are responsible for ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of network infrastructure, including routers, switches, firewalls, servers, and other networking devices      Here are some key responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the role of a Network Engineer:Network Design and Planning: Designing and planning network architecture based on business requirements      Network Engineers assess network needs, select appropriate technologies and hardware, and create network diagrams and documentation      Network Implementation and Configuration: Deploying and configuring network equipment such as routers, switches, firewalls, and load balancers      Network Engineers ensure proper connectivity, security, and optimal performance by configuring IP addresses, VLANs, routing protocols, and access control lists      Network Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Monitoring network performance and troubleshooting network issues      Network Engineers use network monitoring tools to identify and resolve network outages, latency issues, or bottlenecks      They analyze network traffic patterns, perform packet captures, and investigate security incidents      Network Security: Implementing and maintaining network security measures to protect against unauthorized access, data breaches, and cyber threats      Network Engineers configure firewalls, VPNs (Virtual Private Networks), and intrusion detection/prevention systems      They conduct security assessments and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations      Network Maintenance and Upgrades: Performing regular network maintenance tasks, including firmware upgrades, patch management, and hardware replacements      Network Engineers collaborate with vendors and service providers to schedule maintenance windows and minimize disruptions to network services
column11: Patch management, Technical management, Network design, Networking, Network security, network services, Hardware, Windows, Firmware, Network maintenance
