column2: In this position, you will provide design, implementation, and troubleshooting support of network infrastructure in both our internal and customer networks across the globe.          Key Job Responsibilities        Work crossfunctionally with internal and external customers to define deliverables for the buildout of distributed IP networks over large geographic areas.      Generate deployment plans for new networks or changes to existing networks.      Install, configure and maintain IP networking equipment from various vendors (e.g. Cisco, Ubiquiti).      Work directly with engineers in the field to troubleshoot and resolve networking issues.      Establish secure VPN access to customer/remote networks.      Analyze report network traffic flow and take necessary actions to improve performance reliability.      Create and maintain detailed documentation on network configuration, providing necessary input into operations and internal troubleshooting guidelines.      Maintain, patch and update network infrastructure to ensure infrastructure is performing as expected at appropriate version levels.      Manage backups and DR services related to network infrastructure.            Minimum Requirements        Experience designing, implementing, and operating IP networks.      Solid understanding of IP addressing, filtering, subnetting, and routing.      Experience with layer 2 technologies (802.1q VLANs, STP, ARP, etc.).      Familiarity with network troubleshooting tools (tcpdump, nmap, etc.).      Knowledge and expertise with different IP networking vendors (Cisco, Ubiquti, pfSense, etc.).      Experience with IOS, EdgeOS or similar network vendor CLI .      Have a fundamental understanding of Linux/Unix-based systems.      Knowledge of a common scripting language (Python, Perl, shell).      Strong analysis and diagnostic skills with the ability to to problem-solve complex situations under pressure, utilizing troubleshooting skills, systems, and tools.      Ability to work within a team in a fast-paced environment with limited supervision.      Ability to produce clean, concise diagrams and documentation.      Bachelor s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems or related technical field is preferred.

column2: A Network Security professional is responsible for protecting an organization's computer systems, networks, and data from cyber threats and unauthorized access. The job duties typically include:      Designing, implementing, and maintaining security measures such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and virtual private networks (VPNs).      Monitoring network traffic for potential security breaches and taking preventive measures to address identified threats.      Performing regular security audits and vulnerability assessments to identify potential weaknesses in the network.      Developing and implementing security policies and procedures to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of sensitive information.      Responding to security incidents and investigations, including forensic analysis and recovery efforts.      Staying informed of the latest security trends, threats, and technologies, and updating security measures accordingly.      Collaborating with other IT and security professionals to develop and implement integrated security strategies.The ideal candidate should have experience in network security and a strong understanding of security principles, technologies, and industry best practices.
column11: LAN, Network security, WiFi, Firewall

column2: Layout Design: Developing detailed and optimized layouts for various integrated circuits, ensuring they meet performance, power, and area specifications      This involves placing transistors, interconnects, and other components on the semiconductor substrate      Custom Layout: Designing custom layouts for specific circuits, which may include analog circuits, digital circuits, mixed-signal circuits, or radio-frequency (RF) circuits      Physical Verification: Conducting physical verification processes, such as design rule checking (DRC) and layout versus schematic (LVS) checks, to ensure that the layout adheres to fabrication rules and accurately reflects the intended schematic design      Technology Nodes: Working with advanced semiconductor manufacturing processes and technology nodes, which may involve sub-10nm processes, FinFET technology, or other cutting-edge techniques      CAD Tools: Proficiency in using Computer-Aided Design (CAD) tools and layout software for IC design, such as Cadence Virtuoso, Synopsys IC Compiler, or Mentor Graphics Calibre      Optimization: Optimizing layout designs for factors like power consumption, signal integrity, electromagnetic interference (EMI), and manufacturability
column11: Layout design, Mixed signal, Analog layout

Job Description: -     We are seeking a talented and experienced Azure Cloud Solutions Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of designing, implementing, and managing Azure cloud solutions in enterprise environments. As an Azure Cloud Solutions Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring the reliability, scalability, and security of our Azure infrastructure while also collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative solutions. Responsibilities: Design, implement, and manage Azure cloud solutions tailored to meet the needs of enterprise environments. Utilize in-depth knowledge of Azure services and features, including Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Storage, Azure      Networking, and Azure Security, to architect robust and scalable solutions. Develop and maintain Azure Infrastructure as Code (IaC)      using ARM templates, Terraform, or similar tools to automate deployment and configuration processes. Leverage Azure DevOps, Azure Monitor, and other Azure management and monitoring tools to optimize performance and ensure the reliability of Azure infrastructure. Implement and manage containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, including Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), to containerize applications and streamline deployment processes. Script and automate tasks using PowerShell, Azure CLI,      or similar languages to improve operational efficiency and streamline workflows. Troubleshoots complex Azure infrastructure and application issues, demonstrating excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into scalable and reliable Azure solutions. Stay current with emerging Azure technologies and best practices, and actively pursue Azure certifications (e.g., Azure      Administrator, Azure Solutions Architect) to continuously enhance skills and expertise. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Proven experience designing, implementing, and managing Azure cloud solutions in enterprise environments. In-depth knowledge of Azure services and features, including Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Storage, Azure Networking, and Azure Security. Strong proficiency in Azure Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using ARM templates, Terraform, or similar tools. Hands-on experience with Azure DevOps, Azure Monitor, and other Azure management and monitoring tools. Familiarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). Experience with scripting and automation using  PowerShell, Azure CLI, or similar languages. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex Azure infrastructure and application issues. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Azure certifications (e.g., Azure Administrator, Azure Solutions Architect) are a plus.

column2: Network Design: They plan and design network architectures, taking into consideration the organization's needs, goals, and scalability requirements     Infrastructure Setup: Networking experts set up and configure network hardware and software components, including routers, switches, firewalls, and servers     Network Protocols: They are well-versed in various network protocols, such as TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, BGP, and OSPF, and understand how to configure and troubleshoot them     Security: Ensuring network security is a top priority     They implement security measures, such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and encryption, to protect against cyber threats     Troubleshooting: Diagnosing and resolving network issues, including connectivity problems, performance bottlenecks, and security breaches     Performance Optimization: Monitoring and optimizing network performance to ensure data flows efficiently and without delays     Virtualization: Managing virtual networks and cloud-based networking solutions, such as those offered by AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud     Wireless Networking: Configuring and managing wireless networks, including Wi-Fi access points, authentication methods, and encryption protocols     Network Monitoring: Implementing network monitoring tools and practices to keep an eye on network health, detect anomalies, and respond to incidents     Documentation: Maintaining detailed documentation of network configurations, topologies, and changes for reference and troubleshooting
column11: Network design, Intrusion detection, DNS, Network security, Wireless networking, Performance optimization, Infrastructure setup, Virtualization, DHCP, OSPF

column2: A Network Security professional is responsible for protecting an organization's computer systems, networks, and data from cyber threats and unauthorized access.        The job duties typically include:       Designing, implementing, and maintaining security measures such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and virtual private networks (VPNs).     Monitoring network traffic for potential security breaches and taking preventive measures to address identified threats.     Performing regular security audits and vulnerability assessments to identify potential weaknesses in the network.     Developing and implementing security policies and procedures to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of sensitive information.     Responding to security incidents and investigations, including forensic analysis and recovery efforts.     Staying informed of the latest security trends, threats, and technologies, and updating security measures accordingly.     Collaborating with other IT and security professionals to develop and implement integrated security strategies.     The ideal candidate should have experience in network security and a strong understanding of security principles, technologies, and industry best practices.

column2: As a network support engineer trainee, you ll be responsible for maintaining the systems that allow Customer to function and communicate, both internally and externally, on a daily basis.      Depending on your level of responsibility, tasks may include upgrading the company s communications infrastructure or installing a new system.      Specific projects will vary depending on the sector and type of business you work for.      Regardless of the type of business, as a network support engineer Traineeyoull be responsible for designing, installing and maintaining the communications, file sharing and general IT resources used by the organisation      Single point of contact for end user to receive support and maintenance for network system     Installing, diagnosing, repairing, maintaining, and upgrading all hardware and equipment     Diagnose and quickly resolve a wide range of networking problems to help minimize downtime     Perform basic troubleshooting like log collection, capturing environmental challenges, troubleshooting the errors and escalate to L2 if required.     Working with respective teams towards resolution     Implement and monitor security measures for the protection of computer systems, networks and information. Manage and support LANs, WANs, network segments, Internet, and intranet systems. Maintaining, supporting a local and wide-area network (LAN/WAN) that, includes planning, evaluation, configuration, acquisition, design, installation, maintenance, testing, and coordination.     On a day to day basis you will be involved in supporting and troubleshooting network problems; coordinating with vendors/end customers for installation network related enquiry/queries. column2: The Network Planning Analyst position is a remote role, performed from any location worldwide, that reports into the Director of Network Engineering and Operations role. It is a key role that aligns and manages Network demand, current and future, with inventory and resource availability. The position performs a wide range of mission-critical duties and requires functions completed with precision, planned with consideration of delivery and implementation intervals, linked to dependencies and critical path items, and presented with clear and concise language.     Duties include, but are not limited to, the following:     - Produce documented plans for the successful implementation or upgrades of core network functionality, physical interconnections to other networks, hardware installations and upgrades, licenses expansions or utilization, software installations and upgrades, service migrations, and design changes.     - Plan the onboarding and integration of new carriers and/or new carrier products into the Network.     - Monitoring all Network capacity and resources, develop triggers and reports, produce trend-based augments plans, and create detailed projection models based on multiple demand scenarios.     - Track, maintain records, and perform inventory control for all Network hardware, power, licenses, software, firmware, support agreements, circuits, cross connects, and third-party infrastructure.     - Replenish, or complete planned expansion, of Network resources and assets in a cost effective and timely fashion to ensure exhaustion does not occur.     - Pro-actively distribute current vendor contact, location, access, and escalation information to Operations staff to facilitate timely and seamless communication during service impairment or outage conditions.     - Provide instructions and support to AireSpring departments on Network components for insurance, purchasing, provisioning, usage, location, support contracts, service contract, and features discussion activities.     The Network Planning Analyst works tightly and daily with these seven AireSpring departments, in addition to Network equipment vendors and service providers:     - Network Engineering and Operations     - Voice Engineering and Operations     - HPBX Engineering and Operations     - Access Product Management     - Product Management     - Finance     - Information Technology     Qualifications       Qualifications for the Network Planning Analyst role:     - Possess solid overall understanding of Network infrastructure and operations for routers, switches, voice platforms, security devices, licenses, software, power, inside plant engineering, support contracts, OSI layers, transport and transmission, encapsulation methods, aggregation methods, and inventory management.     - Be adept in devising methods to capture and store data, generating reports, and producing trend material.     - Proven history of producing highly detailed Network planning documents that outline the tactical and strategic methods, with justifications, on planned changes taking place on a Network.     - Expert in the fabrication and maintenance of complex Microsoft Excel spreadsheets that integrate past, current, and future datapoints into multi-faceted cost and resource scaling models.     - Capable of consistently applying diligence and focus on data, and ensuring information presented to others is correct.     - Network Engineering functional experience in a service provider environment for a minimum of 3 years.     - Background in financial modeling and vendor negotiations.     ?
column11: Planning Analyst, Product management, Fabrication, Excel, Network engineering, core network, Firmware, Network planning, Information technology, Monitoring

column2: ?     Application security engineers to take on the application security projects entrusted to us by our clients. We have well-defined skill levels (L1 through L6) for which we recruit candidates and also use those skill levels to create career progression paths for the engineers. Please carefully review the levels below and specify the level which best describes your    current skills    on the next page.       Security Engineer ( Levels L1 to L3)            Level1         L1 engineers will be expected to use our standardized web-application test plan to provide depth and breadth coverage on client web-applications and API services where they are generally paired with more experienced engineers on projects. They are also expected to start learning how to write good reports for basic security issues. They are expected to graduate to the next level within 12 months of starting this role.         Level 2         L2 engineers should first meet the requirements for an L1 engineer and also be capable of performing Basic Network Scans , AWS Cloud Configuration reviews, basic Android app testing, and should be able to write quality reports for all types of issues as well as final reports for clients. They should also have any one of these additional skills:     Basic iOS Testing     GCP Cloud Config Review     Azure Cloud Config Review.     L2 engineers will also be expected to contribute to internal skills improvement programs and knowledge sharing sessions. They are also expected to attend report read-out calls to gain experience in client expectations. They are expected to graduate to the next level within 12 months of starting the role which requires completing an OSCP (or approved equivalent) certification.         Level 3         L3 engineers should have min 2 years of professional experience and be capable of performing advanced testing on both Android and iOS projects. They should also be capable of performing Advanced Network Assessments and basic testing of Thick-Client applications. In addition to writing reports, they will also be expected to peer reviews reports from other engineers as well as help junior engineers with their reporting.     L3 engineers are expected to actively participate in report read-out calls with clients and they are expected to graduate to the next role within 2 years of starting this role.       Senior Security Engineer ( Levels L4 to L6)            Level 4         L4 engineers are expected to lead teams during web and mobile application projects and should be capable of fully assessing all web, mobile, and thick-client applications. They should also be capable of performing full network assessments, cloud configuration reviews, containers configuration review and also be able to review source code in two widely used languages. They are required to have completed certifications for GCP, AWS, and Azure cloud Platforms.     L4 Engineers are expected to lead kick-off calls with clients as well as lead final report read-out calls and act as the trusted advisor for the client. They are expected to graduate to the next role within 24 months of starting this role.         Level 5         L5 engineers are highly experienced Senior Security Engineers who also know how to perform Threat Modeling for client solutions and can review source code in multiple languages.         Level 6         L6 engineers are considered consistent leaders who can be counted on to always deliver quality to our clients. They may or may not have additional technical qualifications over an L5 engineer but their experience with client projects and leading other engineers sets them apart.     ?
column11: Design review, GCP, Cloud, Security testing, Healthcare, Test planning, Application security, Android, Penetration testing
